description.narrative: The project idea originated in 2003. It was noticed that Baled-Hawon area is urgently in need of assistance for basic education as well as a new organization of the school building. Diaspora in Finland and other countries have been collecting money and bui lt gradually Waaberi school. Action has been initiated with the support of Ministry of Foreign Affairs and has been the opportunity to Waaberi primary school to take more than 668 7-16 year old pupils and nine staff members which is a major development ste p in the region. The number of pupils tripled and number of staff doubled during the first two years of the project. The local people local administration and the federal government are involved and committed to the project and there has been a lot of medi a exposure and positive attention concerning the school project both in Somalia and abroad. In the project's second phase the teachers are recruited and school buildings are maintained and improved the teaching materials are renewed (such as books desks). In the next years the number of students will increase up to 1200 pupils. Due to that the school will gain more tuitions and will be able to cover 80% of the teachers wages. In addition the project will be further introduced to parents regional authorities and residents as well as religious leaders to improve school safety and improve reliability. The project aims to ensure equal access to school for all groups including those in vulnerable position (e.g. girls the poor) and environmental issues are taken i nto account. On the third year the goal is to transfer responsibility and the upkeep of the school to the local authorities. The project aims also to the independence and continuity of the school.
